Articles.Content:
Esinohio, are you accepting renders of ships with fairings? Last I learned, they appeared.. weird.. in Blender.

Thanks!

They do import wonky but I can always give it a shot and recreate them from scratch within Blender. The coloring might be off but I *think* I should be able to recreate those and come fairly close on the aesthetics part.

While cruising the ever inspiring Craft Exchange thread I stumbled across this awesome sub. The render below only shows the outside but this one has a great interior as well! In pTrevTrevs thread you can find all kinds of eye candy showing off each part of this sub. Find his thread here!
Wow.. these are cool, might ask you later to do one for my life - sized Saturn V when it is finished, AMAZING WORK!

Wow.. these are cool, might ask you later to do one for my life - sized Saturn V when it is finished, AMAZING WORK!

I'd love to render it! I can already see the roaring flames on that one. Getting those flames just right to capture the power of the Saturn V engines would be a great challenge.

They do import wonky but I can always give it a shot and recreate them from scratch within Blender. The coloring might be off but I *think* I should be able to recreate those and come fairly close on the aesthetics part.

Damnit, about 70% of my ships have fairings..

I've yet to make one without.
Incredible and fascinating work! esinohio!
Someone recently built me a spacesheep. I just need a space barn and a space pasture, then there can be a faux space countryside advertisement poster :3
Has anyone requested a Rockwell International B-1B Lancer? If not I'd love to see that in KSP

Could you make me a render of my new space shuttle? Might be hard because it uses a lot of fairings.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/135358-Kerlantis-NASA-Space-Shuttle-Replica
I'll give it a go. The fairings will most likely need to be done from scratch. Would a copy of the orange tank like in your picture above look ok to you?

I'll give it a go. The fairings will most likely need to be done from scratch. Would a copy of the orange tank like in your picture above look ok to you?

Yeah of course. You could probably just copy and paste in the real shuttle EFT haha
The landed spacecraft on the icy moon with the gas giant in the background although a little cliche this is absolutely beautiful, very nice work.

I'll give it a go. The fairings will most likely need to be done from scratch. Would a copy of the orange tank like in your picture above look ok to you?

Considered making it a reentry scene with the flames. That would look equally as nice as the launch

If anyone's doing a countryside scene (or a Dunatian ranch) feel free to add Lamb Rovers to brighten up the place with their electric sheep cuteness

Actually what's the upper limit for number of parts in a render? Could do some extreme sheep herding scenes with hundreds of these!

If anyone's doing a countryside scene (or a Dunatian ranch) feel free to add Lamb Rovers to brighten up the place with their electric sheep cuteness

Actually what's the upper limit for number of parts in a render? Could do some extreme sheep herding scenes with hundreds of these!

http://i.imgur.com/CxNo7BR.jpg

As I know of their is no limits in blender. It will begin to lag but MAN I wanna try rendering a herd of those cute little toys! I believe all the parts should import in blender. Im going to check that out and probably render it myself just for the fun Once you import one craft in blender I can shift + d the craft and replicate it without importing it. Like in this picture. Hoorray for country side sheeps

The craft file for the lambs:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/135784-For-Dunatian-Ranchers-LAMB-ROVER%21-Keep-well-oiled-to-produce-the-finest-Steel-Wool-in-the-Galaxy%21

Would love to see your results :3

Just as I feared, the goo containers dont import, the only way to actually add the eyes is to manually add a "fake" thing or go through the hassle of trying to add a single part craft into the render which is just time consuming.

I think you could workaround by creating a simple white cylinder with a grayish dot on the front with similar dimensions, insert into the respective areas of the 'face'. Most of the part is clipped into the reaction wheel and parachute anyway

I think you could workaround by creating a simple white cylinder with a grayish dot on the front with similar dimensions, insert into the respective areas of the 'face'. Most of the part is clipped into the reaction wheel and parachute anyway

Im currently working on that as a matter of fact!

Update: Restored the cute fur ball

Edited October 4, 2015 by ghostbuzzer7
Oh man that's totally cute!

Oh man that's totally cute!

Im planning on adding around 100 of those little things and calling it CUTENESS Army

or a kerbal running from a herd

Can you imagine the ending scene of Star Wars Episode 2 with the Clone Army embarking on Star Destroyers....

Except they're all electric sheep

This could be their flag:

Can you imagine the ending scene of Star Wars Episode 2 with the Clone Army embarking on Star Destroyers....

Except they're all electric sheep

This could be their flag:

http://i.imgur.com/UtlWdc7.png

Or like in ancient times when they raised their flag in war!

If anyone's doing a countryside scene (or a Dunatian ranch) feel free to add Lamb Rovers to brighten up the place with their electric sheep cuteness

Actually what's the upper limit for number of parts in a render? Could do some extreme sheep herding scenes with hundreds of these!

http://i.imgur.com/CxNo7BR.jpg

These are awesome!!!! My neighbor had his kids over in my home yesterday and they caught a glimpse of this on my computer screen. The ensuing giggling made my day. As for the part limit like ghostbuzzer7 said there is not a part limit really in Blender. It breaks down to the number of faces on the models and the amount of RAM you have. Fortunately for us the artists who made the parts did so with amazingly few faces. If ghostbuzzer7 doesn't get what you need I'll be happy to do something with it.

- - - Updated - - -

Im planning on adding around 100 of those little things and calling it CUTENESS Army

or a kerbal running from a herd

If you wanted to do a quick animation of that cuteness army do a Google search on "Blender boids". You can quickly get an army of sheep chasing a lone fleeing Kerbal. Enjoy!

You better watch out, you better hide, the sheep are coming to the KSC tonight in the morning. They will take all your snacks, rob you of your funds but fortunately, they love to snooze at night! ooh the sheep are coming.... to KSC
